title: Body text font
content:
Hello, this is my firtst post here!

Could anyone please let me know what the font of the main text in this article is?  
 [http://blog.up.co/2014/01/22/learnfest-brings-startup-weekend-edu-brazil/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005655/http:/blog.up.co/2014/01/22/learnfest-brings-startup-weekend-edu-brazil/)

I have also attached an image of the page. Any help would be much appreciated!

Thank you!

Font: 

 Proxima Nova A 

Solved By: 

 [Les ONeill](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005655/http:/typophile.com/user/216897 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Startupweekend font.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005655/http:/typophile.com/files/Startupweekend%20font.png) | 167.73 KB |
author: fka

comments.content:
I don't think it's Proxima Nova, there many differences not just the /a:  
/E middle bar is higher (on sample)  
/y & /l are obviously different  
/e, /b, /d also look different (vertical bar of /b/d is shorter on sample)  
...

Whatfont app says Proxima Nova too …

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PN_5306.png)

You are both right, _it is_ actually "Proxima Nova A" (I suppose "A" stand for alternate) which contains alternate characters for /y/l/ etc:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005655/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova/")
